content: Note: Total high-risk debt is the sum of speculative-grade and unrated bonds and leveraged loans. Nominal outstandings growth is translated into real terms after subtracting the growth rate of the price deflator for nonfinancial business-sector output.  Disclaimer for S&P data: S&P and its third-party information providers expressly disclaim the accuracy and completeness of  the information provided to the Board, as well as any errors or omissions arising from the use of such information. Further, the information provided herein does not constitute, and should not be used as, advice regarding the suitability of securities for  investment purposes or any other type of investment advice.  Source: Mergent Corporate FISD Daily Feed, Nominal Bonds Outstanding, www.mergent.com/mergent-solutions/fixed- income-data; Standard & Poor’s, Leveraged Commentary and Data (LCD).  -5  0  5  10  15  20  25  2002 2004 2006 2008 2010 2012 2014 2016  Figure 7:  Year-over-Year Growth of Real Total High-Risk DebtPercent,  annual rate
